entry.et: Middle English, from Old English rīpe; akin to Old English rīpan, reopan to reap

def.dt: :fully grown and developed :mature ripe fruit ripe wheat
:of advanced years :late a ripe old age
:suitable appropriate the time was ripe for the attempt
:fully prepared :ready the colonies were ripe for revolution
:brought by aging to full flavor or the best state :mellow ripe cheese
:ruddy, plump, or full like ripened fruit a ripe figure
